intro: Thalictrum humile, commonly known as the meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in early spring, which are arranged in compound umbels. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Thalictrum humile prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland margins or meadows.
